entry.title: Stuck in analysis
entry.body: I spend too much time researching before starting anything. Last week I spent 4 hours comparing project management tools instead of working on my actual project.

outputs.editor:
SUMMARY:
You spend time researching tools instead of starting the project.
FIXES:
- "too much time researching": specify the time frame and threshold.
- "before starting anything": name the specific task delayed.
- "actual project": clarify what the project is.
REWRITE:
I spend too much time researching tools and delay starting my actual project.
outputs.definer:
KEY TERMS:
- perfectionism: the need to have everything ideal before moving forward
- procrastination: delaying important tasks in favor of less important ones
- analysis paralysis: unable to make decisions due to overthinking
AMBIGUITIES:
- "too much time": unclear threshold for what counts as excessive
BOUNDARIES:
- Not claiming: this is about the tools themselves.
- Not claiming: the project is inherently too complex.
outputs.skeptic:
CORE CLAIM:
You avoid starting by researching tools instead.
CHALLENGES:
- "spent 4 hours comparing": this could be legitimate setup work, not avoidance.
- "instead of working": you may be underestimating the value of selecting tools.
- "actual project": if the project is unclear, research may be necessary.
TEST:
Spend one 60-minute block on the project without tool research this week.
outputs.coach:
INTENT:
You want to start the project but get stuck researching tools ("4 hours comparing").
OPTIONS:
- Pick one tool today and start a first task, risking suboptimal tooling. Done looks like one task completed.
- Set a 30-minute research cap and begin anyway, risking uncertainty. Done looks like a started task.
- Freeze tool choice for 7 days, risking regret. Done looks like no tool changes.
RECOMMENDATION:
Pick one tool today because it closes the loop on research and forces action. It closes the option of more tool shopping for 7 days.
FOR THE NEXT 7 DAYS, STOP:
- Comparing new tools
- Changing your tool choice
